title: Mercedes EQB Specs
text:
Price: $66,520
Lease Price: ~$520/mo for 36 months
Tax Incentives: Qualifies for $7,500 of EV tax incentives

title: Mercedes EQB Specs
text:
Exterior:
The Mercedes‑EQB 350 4MATIC has a boxy, modern look with smooth lines and a strong SUV shape. The front features a closed-off grille, sleek LED headlights, and a light bar that gives it a high-tech feel. From the side, it has a sporty profile with bold wheels and a smooth roofline. At the back, the light bar continues across the rear, adding to its stylish and futuristic design.

title: Mercedes EQB Specs
text:
Specs:

0-60 and Horsepower: The Mercedes EQB 350 4MATIC SUV has a 0-60 of 5.8 seconds and 288 hp
Range and Charging: Has ~207 miles of range and is compatible with Tesla DC superchargers
Reliability: The EQB has received positive feedback for its fit and finish, and the 2025 model has no reported recalls from the NHTSA

title: Hyundai IONIQ 9 Specs
text:
Price: $64,600
Lease Price: ~$450/mo for 36 months
Tax Incentives: Qualifies for $13,000 of EV tax incentives

title: Hyundai IONIQ 9 Specs
text:
Exterior:
The IONIQ 9 exterior masterfully blends aerodynamic efficiency with design artistry. Its dynamic “boat‑tail” silhouette, signature pixel lighting, sculptural side accents, and clean, futuristic detailing make it a standout in the large‑SUV EV segment.

title: Hyundai IONIQ 9 Specs
text:
Specs:

0-60 and Horsepower: The Hyundai IONIQ 9 has a 0-60 of 6.2 seconds and 303 hp
Range and Charging: The IONIQ 9 has ~320 miles of range and is compatible with Tesla DC superchargers
Reliability: The Hyundai IONIQ 9 has won the Favorite Plug-in EV – Awarded by the Midwest Automotive Media Association. Best Seven-Seat EV – Crowned by Top Gear. Red Dot Award: Global Product Design 2025

title: Car Shopping
text:
A sleek ride, right?


Look around and compare the cars. Link to Slideshow:
https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1jvlR61SVcH4eUqlgMXgFS6Jlc96sm2GNQjcybW0Dge0/edit?slide=id.p#slide=id.p

title: Comparison/Rankings
text:
My rankings (Best for our purposes):

KIA EV9 (Best performance and space with decent luxury and premium charging capabilities)
Mercedes EQB 350 4MATIC SUV (Brand name, luxury, and premium features)
Hyundai IONIQ 9 (Longest range, wheelbase, and fast-charging)

title: Comparison/Rankings
text:
Consumer rankings:

KIA EV9 (Best blend of performance (up to 379 hp), range (up to 304 miles), ultra-fast charging (350 kW), and futuristic design. It also offers a spacious interior, advanced tech like AutoMode (hands-free driving), and a strong value proposition)
Hyundai IONIQ 9 (Shares the same platform as the EV9 but leans more into luxury and comfort. It offers a longer range (up to 335 miles), massage seats, a quieter ride, and a more refined interior. Slightly less performance-focused than the EV9 but more upscale)
Mercedes EQB 350 4MATIC SUV (While it brings Mercedes-Benz luxury and solid build quality, it falls short on range (around 250 miles), charging speed (100 kW max), and interior space compared to the other two. It’s also the smallest and least powerful of the bunch)

title: Kia Specs
text:
Price: $67,940
Lease Price: ~$540/mo for 36 months
Tax Incentives: Qualifies for $7,500 of EV tax incentives and a few other incentives from KIA

title: Kia Specs
text:
Exterior:
The Kia EV9 features a bold, modern design with a boxy SUV shape and futuristic touches. Its standout front includes vertical LED headlights and a unique “Digital Tiger Face,” while sharp lines, flush door handles, and a tapered roofline give it a sleek, high-tech look. It is easily the best 7-seater EV on the market

title: Kia Specs
text:
Specs:

0-60 and Horsepower: The Kia EV9 has a 0-60 of 6.0 seconds and 379 hp
Range and Charging: The Kia EV9 has ~275 miles of range and is compatible with Tesla DC superchargers
Reliability: The Kia EV9 has been named 2024 North American Utility Vehicle of the Year and World Car of the Year, among others
